From Angie’s mom

http://localhost:4000/recipes/banana-bread.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/banana-bread.html breakfast, baking Broccoli Beer Cheese Soup

This recipe is inspired by one of my favorites, Gourmand’s Beer Cheese Soup, which uses Shiner Bock. Feel free to use whatever you want, then go to Gourmand’s to have the real thing.

http://localhost:4000/recipes/broccoli-cheese-soup.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/broccoli-cheese-soup.html sides, soups Crockpot Buffalo Chicken

This is a party favorite, perfect for a Super Bowl or a game night. It takes a long time, but like most slow cooker recipes, is easy as hell. Bonus: guests love it.

http://localhost:4000/recipes/crockpot-buffalo-chicken.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/crockpot-buffalo-chicken.html mains, grill, party Downtown Marinade

This is my go-to marinade for everything from steaks to shrimp to fajitas to pork. Seriously, if I’m cooking or grilling meat, there’s a good chance this is what it’s soaking in. It’s perfect for “street meat” aka cart or truck, like tacos and wraps and kebabs and skewers and everything in between. Start with this base, add spice or herb as desired.

http://localhost:4000/recipes/downtown-chowdown-marinade.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/downtown-chowdown-marinade.html party, meat Green Chile Stew

This is a simple one, consisting of a pre-made soup mix and whatever you’ve got around the kitchen (or campsite). Feel free to sub/swap/switch anything in the ingredient list— anything’s fair game!

http://localhost:4000/recipes/green-chile-stew.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/green-chile-stew.html <<<<<<< HEAD sides, soups ======= hauptgericht,backen >>>>>>> gh-pages Mongolian Beef

A quick go-to dinner. Can be made with almost any meat. I often used ground. Works perfect for lettuce wraps. Try replacing the onion with thinly sliced fennel.

Optional: spice this thing up, with a dose of your favorite chili paste/sauce.

http://localhost:4000/recipes/mongolian-beef.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/mongolian-beef.html mains, meat New York Strip

Cooking a steak in a water bath is the ultimate, both in terms of flavor and laziness. Dial in a precise temperature, then go take a nap.

http://localhost:4000/recipes/new-york-strip.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/new-york-strip.html mains, meat <<<<<<< HEAD Nilla Wafer French Toast

From a weird Sunday morning when I realized we didn’t have bread. Solid hitter. Served with Treehive Syrup, my new favorite breakfast obsession (it’s mixed with honey, vanilla, and cinnamon, oof).

======= Pizzateig >>>>>>> gh-pages http://localhost:4000/recipes/nilla-wafer-french-toast.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/nilla-wafer-french-toast.html <<<<<<< HEAD breakfast, baking ======= simpel,backen >>>>>>> gh-pages One Minute Muffin

This flax muffin is quick, vertsatile (just mix in other goodies), and only makes one at a time, so you’ve got no huge tray to tempt you. Custom muffins every morning!

http://localhost:4000/recipes/one-minute-muffin.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/one-minute-muffin.html breakfast Pork Steaks

Pork is called “the other white meat”, but this sous vide technique is so dang good I’m gonna graduate it up to “THE white meat”.

http://localhost:4000/recipes/pork-steaks.html http://localhost:4000/recipes/pork-steaks.html mains, meat
